intro: Sphenostigma caeruleum, commonly known as the blue star, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive blue-violet flowers. It is native to South America and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that contribute to its ornamental value. Its flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Sphenostigma caeruleum is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and color.
